p: SV: On an individual level, as Sofía has already commented, Latin American governments have had different positions, from those that have dismantled the entire food security system to those that have more progressive positions and are trying to change or transform food systems, particularly in light of the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. In these contexts, food was underpinned as a fundamental element inducing diseases on people in Latin America and that the pandemic made clear these health pre-conditions made people more vulnerable to the infection by COVID-19.
